com.emeryferrari.jse3d.obj

Class Vector3

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emeryferrari.jse3d.obj.Vector3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Vector3
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a 3D vector.
    Since:
    2.2
    Author:
    Alyx Ferrari
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Vector3 back
      Represents a vector pointing backwards.

      Represents a vector pointing downwards.

      Represents a vector pointing forwards.
      static Vector3 left
      Represents a vector pointing left.
      static Vector3 negativeInfinity
      Represents a vector with a magnitude of Math3D.hypot3(Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY).
      static Vector3 one
      Represents a vector with a magnitude of Math3D.hypot3(1.0).
      static Vector3 positiveInfinity
      Represents a vector with a magnitude of Math3D.hypot3(Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY).

      Represents a vector pointing right.
      static Vector3 up
      Represents a vector pointing upwards.
      static Vector3 zero
      Represents a vector with a magnitude of 0.

        public Vector3 movePosAbs(double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          Display display)
        Moves this vector relative to (0,0,0).
        Parameters:
        x - Desired x value.
        y - Desired y value.
        z - Desired z value.
        display - The Display object being used to render this vector.
        Returns:
        The Vector3 on which this method was called.

      • movePosAbs

        public Vector3 movePosAbs(double x,
                          double y,
                          double z,
                          Vector3 camPos)
        Moves this vector relative to (0,0,0).
        Parameters:
        x - Desired x value.
        y - Desired y value.
        z - Desired z value.
        camPos - Position of the camera (result of Display.getCameraPosition(), not Display.getCameraPositionActual()).
        Returns:
        The Vector3 on which this method was called.

      • transitionPosAbs

        public Vector3 transitionPosAbs(double x,
                                double y,
                                double z,
                                int millis,
                                Display display)
        Transitions this vector's position relative to (0,0,0) over a specified number of milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        x - Desired x value.
        y - Desired y value.
        z - Desired z value.
        millis - How many milliseconds it should take to transition this vector's position.
        display - The Display object being used to render this vector.
        Returns:
        The Vector3 on which this method was called.

      • transitionPosAbs

        public Vector3 transitionPosAbs(double x,
                                double y,
                                double z,
                                int millis,
                                Vector3 camPos,
                                int physicsTimestep)
        Transitions this vector's position relative to (0,0,0) over a specified number of milliseconds with a specified timestep.
        Parameters:
        x - Desired x value.
        y - Desired y value.
        z - Desired z value.
        millis - How many milliseconds it should take to transition this vector's position.
        camPos - Position of the camera (result of Display.getCameraPosition(), not Display.getCameraPositionActual()).
        physicsTimestep - The timestep that should be used to transition this vector's position.
        Returns:
        The Vector3 on which this method was called.
